related_questions.question: What are the main uses of bismuth?
related_questions.snippet: Bismuth metal is brittle and so it is usually mixed with other metals to make it useful. Its alloys with tin or cadmium have low melting points and are used in fire detectors and extinguishers, electric fuses and solders.
related_questions.title: Bismuth - Element information, properties and uses

related_questions.question: How toxic is bismuth to humans?
related_questions.snippet: Bismuth compounds are considered relatively non-toxic, with their low solubility in aqueous solutions (e.g., biological fluids) being the major contributing factor to this property. Bismuth derivatives are widely used for the treatment of peptic ulcers, functional dyspepsia, and chronic gastritis.
related_questions.title: Bioactive Bismuth Compounds: Is Their Toxicity a Barrier to ...

related_questions.question: Why is bismuth used in Pepto-Bismol?
related_questions.title: AI Overview
list: Antimicrobial Action: Bismuth subsalicylate can kill or inhibit the growth of certain bacteria and viruses that can cause diarrhea.
Anti-inflammatory Effects: It reduces inflammation in the stomach and intestines, which can contribute to symptoms like heartburn and indigestion.
Antisecretory Properties: It helps to decrease the amount of fluid and electrolytes that are released into the intestines, which can help to reduce diarrhea.
Protective Barrier: It coats the lining of the stomach and intestines, providing a protective layer that can help to soothe and reduce irritation.
Mild Antacid: It also has mild antacid properties, which can help to neutralize excess stomach acid and provide relief from heartburn.

related_questions.question: What is the drug bismuth used for?
related_questions.snippet: Description. Bismuth subsalicylate is used to treat diarrhea in adults and teenagers. It is also used to relieve the symptoms of an upset stomach, such as heartburn, indigestion, and nausea in adults and teenagers. This medicine is available without a prescription.
